body_text.text: As the epidemic continue progressing globally, there would be an increasing number of pilgrims returning to their homelands. We totally agreed with the suggestion for these home countries to prepare adequate quarantine infrastructure. 2 And in order to prevent the community transmission caused by returning pilgrims, the border inspection and quarantine strategy should be tightened for the returnees from all the Muslim countries, but not limited to Saudi Arabia.

FIGREF0.text: epidemic spread over the world during the first quarter of 2020, 2019 novel coronavirus diseases (COVID-19) has become an international issue. By early April, the global case number has exceeded 1 million cases. 1 A correspondence published on the Lancet several weeks ago have noticed the risk of getting COVID-19 infection from Muslim pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia. 2 The authors alerted the home countries of the pilgrims to make early preparation for such potential outbreak. Of course, Mecca, Saudi Arabia is the holiest city among the Islam world, almost 2 million pilgrims from over 180 countries would attend Mecca for Hajj pilgrimage annually. 3 However, the similar alarm for otherMuslim country should also be considered. In the late March, we confirmed 6 cases with COVID-19 among the passages of a flight from Pakistan after border inspection in Guangzhou, China. These 6 cases had pilgrimaged at a masjid in Pakistan together for at least 6 months and returned China due to the panic of the local COVID-19 epidemic.
